required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study on Safety and Performance of RTI spINE Products

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective, multi-center, open label registry designed to collect real-world data on performance and safety data on RTI's spine products.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Rates of reoperation and/or revision procedures at index level

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fusion success measures by radiological assessment (x-ray, CT scan, MRI, etc.)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of procedure and device related adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain as determined by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first reoperation and/or revision procedure at index leve

intervention.description: Interbody fusion devices - intended to help facilitate fusion by providing a platform for bone growth, while maintaining height and decompression. Supplemental fixation and/or stabilization devices - are intended to stabilize the spine to allow for fusion to occur, maintain current spinal movement, correct deformities or curvature, treat trauma, spinal stenosis, tumor and pseudarthrosis. Bone graft substitute - is intended to aid in fusion.

study_pop.textblock: Patients that have spinal problems requiring treatment with an RTI Surgical spine product.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Candidate for RTI spine product.
2. Willing and able to consent to the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient who is, or is expected to be inaccessible for follow-up.
2. Patient meets any exclusion criteria required by local law (e.g. age, mental capacity, etc.).
3. Other concurrent medical or other condition (chronic or acute in nature) that in the opinion of the investigator may prevent participation or otherwise render patient ineligible for the study.

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share IPD
